text: Hi All! Is there a way to limit the "Page selector" field in a custom module to a subset of pages? Such as a specific blog?
Locked fields are still showing in global modules :cry:
unfortunately no. Although a blog post field would be nice

Has anyone come up with a nifty way to make global edits to fields across many/all modules, e.g. a set of options in a select field that gets repeated in several modules? My use case is we have a drawer that opens up that reveals one of several forms. Our marketing team would like to be able to use any button in any module to be able to open that drawer and select a form. I can get that working perfectly with a select field, but I’m worried that doing this across all buttons is going to be rather rigid when it comes time to make a change.

Hi all! The Instagram feed on my company’s home page has suddenly broken. The links work but the preview displays a broken image. We haven’t updated anything surrounding that so I’m wondering if anyone else has seen this? Maybe Instagram updated something that caused the images to break?
It’s very possible that Instagram’s API has a new version and they may have deprecated the old version
Thanks for the quick response jon! Is this something that we can fix from our end? I wasn’t the one who set up our companies page but I see we are using the HubSpot Instagram Feed module.

There is no official HubSpot created Instagram module - so it was either custom created for that site or purchased. If the module was installed/purchased off of the marketplace I would contact the seller. <https://marketplace.HubSpot.com/products?searchTerm=instagram&subType=CUSTOM_MODULE>
oooh okay thank you for this! this is helpful!
Alternatively if it’s broken and you can’t find the developer that made it - I suppose maybe consider swapping for one of the ones in the marketplace as an easy win
Sharing from another thread, answer ended up being: `content.widgets.custom_module_name.body.group_name|length`

Hey <@U01CCF1K7RB> depending on how the module is built you might also just need to update the credentials for the library that it’s pulling from. Some of our clients feeds drop and all that needs to be done is chucking a box on a library dashboard someplace. It’s a real easy fix but also a pain. 

Might not be the case for you though. Like Jon said it really depends on how it’s all built!
